themes.scientific_basis: Based on Gottman's research on relationship rituals and the importance of shared meaningful experiences
themes.description: Evaluates the quality and quantity of intentional time couples spend together, measuring both daily interactions and dedicated relationship-building activities

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in emotional exchange theory and research on emotional responsiveness in relationships
themes.description: Assesses the balance of emotional give-and-take between partners, including emotional awareness, validation, and mutual support patterns

themes.scientific_basis: Based on Sternberg's Triangular Theory of Love and research on intimate connection in relationships
themes.description: Measures multiple dimensions of intimacy (emotional, physical, intellectual) and identifies areas for deepening connection

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from gratitude research and studies on positive psychology in relationships
themes.description: Examines how couples express and receive appreciation, including recognition of both major and minor contributions to the relationship

themes.scientific_basis: Based on self-expansion theory and research on personal growth within relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how partners support each other's personal growth while maintaining relationship satisfaction and connection

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in Gottman's Sound Relationship House Theory and research on shared meaning systems
themes.description: Assesses how couples create and maintain shared meaning in their relationship through rituals, goals, and values

themes.scientific_basis: Based on hedonic adaptation prevention research and studies on maintaining relationship excitement
themes.description: Measures couples' ability to maintain excitement and prevent relationship stagnation through healthy novelty and shared adventures

themes.scientific_basis: Derived from stress-buffering hypothesis and research on dyadic coping in relationships
themes.description: Evaluates how effectively partners support each other during stress and protect their relationship satisfaction from external pressures

themes.scientific_basis: Based on attachment theory and research on daily relationship maintenance behaviors
themes.description: Assesses the presence and effectiveness of daily connection rituals that maintain relationship satisfaction and emotional bonds

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in work-life balance research and studies on relationship satisfaction in modern contexts
themes.description: Measures how well couples maintain satisfaction while balancing individual needs, relationship demands, and external commitments
